thread.title: ISL 2015: Mumbai FC, Kerala Blasters fail to fire
thread.title_full: ISL 2015: Mumbai FC, Kerala Blasters fail to fire | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna     | From the print edition
title: ISL 2015: Mumbai FC, Kerala Blasters fail to fire
text:
Mumbai City FC’s Darren O’Dea (in white) heads the ball during his side’s ISL encounter against Kerala Blasters in Kochi on Saturday ISL Mumbai FC earned their first points of the Indian Super League (ISL) by holding the Kerala Blasters to a goalless draw at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in Kochi on Saturday,
While Blasters are in third place in the league table at the moment with four points from two outings, the draw sees the Mumbai side lie in sixth position.
For the visitors, their player-cum-manager Nicolas Anelka was out of action due to flu and there were as many as six changes in their side.
Kerala Blasters however replaced last match's goalscorer Mohammed Rafi with former India international Manandeep Singh.
The visitors started on the offensive with Sony Norde in particular looking dangerous on the left. Gabriel Fernandes had the first shot of game in the 5th minute when he blazed a long searching ball from the back over the Kerala Blasters FC goal.The visitors continued with their early pressure and called Kerala keeper Stephen Bywater into action in the 12th minute.
Mumbai kept pushing on, looking more likely of the two sides to break the deadlock. Norde's pace and strength made life difficult for Kerala defenders Rahul Bheke and Gurwinder Singh. His shot in the 38th minute could have easily found the back of the net had it been a yard to the right or left of Bywater.
Both managers rang in the changes in the second half to alter the course of the game. Kerala gaffer Peter Taylor replaced Manandeep Singh with Ishfaq Ahmed while Mumbai City FC's marquee player-cum-coach Nicolas Anelka bought on Ashutosh Mehta and Selim Benachour for Aitor Fernandez Lopez and Thangjam Singh.
Singam had a golden opportunity in the 76th minute to put the visitors ahead when he was through one-on-one with Kerala keeper Bywater. Only a last-ditch tackle by Kerala's skipper Peter Ramage saved the home-team's blushes as the score remained 0-0.
Norde could have put the game to bed two minutes from time but the Haitian failed to wrap his foot around the ball as his shot was dragged wide of the target.
